description.summary: Alleged spirits of deceased humans (or occasionally animals) that manifest through visual appearances, sounds, physical interactions, or other sensory phenomena. One of the most universal and ancient paranormal beliefs.
description.full: Ghosts represent one of humanity's oldest and most universal paranormal beliefs, found in virtually every culture throughout history. The phenomenon encompasses alleged manifestations of deceased individuals including visual apparitions, disembodied voices, unexplained sounds, cold spots, object movement, and electromagnetic disturbances. Hauntings are categorized as intelligent (interactive spirits) or residual (recordings of past events). Investigation methods have evolved from spiritualist seances to modern equipment-based approaches using EMF detectors, thermal cameras, and audio recorders. Despite widespread belief and thousands of reported experiences, no scientific evidence has definitively confirmed ghostly existence.

physical.morphology: Ghosts are typically reported as humanoid figures that may appear solid, translucent, or as misty forms. They often resemble their appearance in life, sometimes at different ages. Some manifest as points of light, orbs, or shadowy figures. Partial apparitions (faces, hands) are also common.

origins.cultural_roots: Ghost beliefs exist in virtually every culture from prehistoric times. Ancient Egyptian, Greek, Roman, Chinese, and other civilizations all documented elaborate beliefs about spirits of the dead.
origins.earliest_accounts: Epic of Gilgamesh (~2100 BCE) contains ghost accounts. Pliny the Younger (~100 CE) recorded classic haunted house story. Every ancient civilization has documented ghost beliefs.
origins.folklore_connections: Intimately connected to ancestor worship, afterlife beliefs, and death rituals worldwide.

history.modern_era: Ghost investigation has evolved from Victorian seances to modern equipment-based approaches using EMF detectors, thermal imaging, audio recorders, and full-spectrum cameras. Ghost hunting TV shows have popularized investigation techniques. Scientific studies remain inconclusive, though parapsychology continues to research survival after death. Ghost tourism is a significant industry worldwide.

notable.name: Enfield Poltergeist
notable.description: Extensive poltergeist activity centered on the Hodgson family, particularly daughters Janet (11) and Margaret (13). Phenomena included furniture movement, knockings, levitation, voices, and fires. Investigated by SPR members Maurice Grosse and Guy Lyon Playfair. Police constable witnessed chair moving. Case lasted 18 months with over 1,500 documented incidents.

credibility.notes: One of most documented poltergeist cases; some incidents later admitted as hoaxes by Janet

notable.name: Brown Lady of Raynham Hall
notable.description: Captain Provand and Indre Shira, photographers for Country Life magazine, were photographing the staircase when Shira saw a veiled figure descending. He took a photograph capturing a translucent figure. The image remains one of the most famous ghost photographs.

credibility.notes: Never definitively explained; possible double exposure suggested

notable.name: Anne Boleyn at Tower of London
notable.description: The ghost of Anne Boleyn, second wife of Henry VIII executed in 1536, has been reported numerous times at the Tower of London, particularly near the Chapel of St. Peter ad Vincula where she is buried. Witnesses describe a headless woman in Tudor dress.

credibility.notes: One of most reported ghosts in Britain

folklore.beliefs: Ghosts are one of humanity's most universal beliefs. Most cultures believe the dead can return under certain conditions (unfinished business, improper burial, violent death). Practices exist worldwide to honor the dead and prevent malevolent haunting.

cultures: All cultures worldwide have ghost/spirit traditions
indigenous.significance: Ancestor spirits play central role in many indigenous religions and practices
indigenous.sensitivity_note: Ghost beliefs are deeply integrated into religious and spiritual practices worldwide
indigenous.respect_guidelines: Approach all cultural ghost traditions with respect; avoid dismissing as mere superstition

research.ongoing_studies: Academic parapsychology continues survival research. Ghost hunting organizations conduct investigations worldwide. Scientific studies examine psychology of ghost experiences and environmental factors in haunted locations.
